page.title: 03A SWALEDALE FARMER'S DAY.
page.content: The first thing my dad does is milk he milks three cows the milk goes to our family not to the milk tanker. Then he starts the main thing for the time of year.If it is lambing time he will go and see the twin lambs first we keep the twins inside. Then he goes and sees the single lambs. Lambs get all different sorts of diseases like pneumonia or rattlebelly and pintail. If it is haytime he will start to mow and kruger and row.If it is silage the rowerputs the silage into rows and then it is bailed. then the beef cattle eat the hay and silage in winter. When they are fat enough they are sold. Our farm is on Whita-Side but my dad has some land further away outside the grid area.
